name: Serafina Fabulous Pizza 79th (UES)
address: 1022 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10075, USA

reviews.text: Wow, so happy we found this place! We went after our trip to The Met and the atmosphere was so welcoming, amazing low romantic lighting, beautiful tables. The food was brilliant. The tiramisu blew my mind. The tartare was utterly delicious. Amazing experience.
One of the best pizzas in New York the ambience is beautiful. Location is wonderful. Service is amazing.

immediately when we got here we heard people complain how they much have rather ate at chipotle then when we go up the lady asked if we had a reservation we said yes maâ€™am then the manager comes up to the front yelling and getting in frontâ€¦

I had low expectations going in,  and was pleasantly surprised by 2 wines by the glass I sampled; a brunello and pinot grigio. The Caesar salad with salmon was excellent with the salmon fresh and cooked perfectly.  A bean soup was adequate.  A creamy dessert was within expectations and a feta salad with watermelon and arugula was also very good.  For lunch on a rainy day, the place was perfect.
Great food.
My favorite place!! Love the pizza!!!!!!!!
Great lunch!
Authentic Italien spot with delicious pizza & homemade pasta. Tiramisu was incredibly good! 10 0f 10
Brilliant

We were disappointed with the service, so we left a smaller tip. Our server then confronted us about it, which felt rude and unprofessional. After we explained, she essentially told us to leaveâ€”as if it were her own restaurant. The food didnâ€™t redeem it either: the pasta was average, and the Aperol Spritz was nothing to write home about. Overall, not worth the hassle. If i dont like the service, i wont tip 20% period.
The food was delicious! Great atmosphere.
Loved the Pepe and the watermelon salad 10/10. Service was great, very clean & the food was good. It gave authentic.
Super service - thank you :)
Fantastic service, always love this location
DifÃ­cil acesso,  muitas escadas. Comida mediana.
Subpar Italian food - this is NYC, standards are higher. Subpar service. Cleanliness was a problem.
The food was good, the artichoke salad was delicious, the pasta was great, atmosphere was nice, easy to find a seat around 3 pm on a Friday.

Tuve una experiencia muy decepcionante en este restaurante. El servicio fue pÃ©simo desde que llegamos: el personal fue descortÃ©s, desorganizado y sin interÃ©s en atender bien. La comida llegÃ³ frÃ­a y sin sabor, nada que ver con lo que uno espera por el precio. Incluso el capitÃ¡n de cocina mostrÃ³ una actitud poco profesional.
Definitivamente no recomendarÃ­a este lugar ni volverÃ­a. Necesitan mejorar mucho en atenciÃ³n, calidad y respeto al cliente.

The experience at Serafina was 5 stars from the moment we walked in the door, were escorted to the beautiful Tuscan style third floor covered Terrace and were welcomed by Henry. He gave an exquisite smile and amazing service. The food was just incredible. Highly recommend!ğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸ

Long awaited and definitely over due to see this wonderful chain and try their Italian cuisine. The menu is simple and not too overwhelming, the staff is attentive and truly accommodating a family of 5 with no reservation. The pizzas are truly delicious and a must try with their perfectly thin crust and toppings. The tiramisu was good, classic and was devoured in a few seconds. Would highly recommend to try if youâ€™re in town or just in need of something delicious and hearty.

Serafina Restaurant in Manhattan is an excellent place to dine, offering good customer service and a warm, welcoming atmosphere. The pizza was delicious, prepared with great flavor and quality, and the restaurant itself is clean and very comfortable, making it a perfect spot to enjoy a relaxing meal in the city.

El restaurante Serafina en Manhattan es un excelente lugar para comer, con un buen servicio al cliente y un ambiente cÃ¡lido y acogedor. La pizza estuvo deliciosa, preparada con gran sabor y calidad, y el restaurante es limpio y muy cÃ³modo, lo que lo convierte en un sitio ideal para disfrutar de una comida relajante en la ciudad.

Serafina Pizza was a great stop while touring Central Park. The Italian food was excellent, and everything we tried was full of flavor. The upstairs area is beautifully decorated to look like a garden, but itâ€™s all indoors, which makes it a perfect escape from the weather. The entrance is a bit hidden from the street, but itâ€™s worth seeking out. The waitstaff can get a little overwhelmed, especially with how close the tables are, but theyâ€™re attentive and work hard to make the experience enjoyable. Definitely a spot Iâ€™d return to.

It was easy to book dinner for a Monday evening. Book to eat on the rooftop terrace, it's air conditioned and beautifully decorated. Their prices are expensive for pasta and pizza but you are spending for the atmosphere and location. An easy walk to the MET. The gnocchi was good. Their lobster ravioli is the real star on their menu, but it is a small serving for a $30 dish. The margarita pizza needs more basil and roma tomatoes, it should not include olives on the pizza. Their pistachio cake crust was soggy and it didn't taste fresh. Service was attentive. Overall a nice place after a long day @ the MET. Try the pistachio and coffee chocolates at the Parisian chocolatier next door!

Super cute location. Great menu. High prices though.

The bruschetta was really good. The penne arrabbiata was amazing and felt like a lot more pasta than I was expecting. I didnâ€™t think it was spicy, but the waitress did mention it and the person I was with thought it was spicy.

It was expensive, but worth it for the vibes and great food.

Serafina never disappoints! From the moment you walk in, youâ€™re welcomed by a warm, inviting atmosphere that feels both elegant and relaxed. The staff is incredibly attentive and friendly, striking the perfect balance between professional and personal.

The food is consistently deliciousâ€”fresh ingredients, beautifully plated, and bursting with flavor. Their pasta is a standout and the thin-crust pizzas are crave-worthy. Great wine selection, too, with something for every palate.

Whether youâ€™re out for a casual lunch, date night, or dinner with friends, Serafina offers a consistently exceptional experience. One of my go-to spots on the Upper East Side!

My first time at one of these establishments, stopped by on a whim and by the aroma. Was seated relatively quickly even with a full house.
We were served relatively quickly and stayed until closing. Salad: delicious, Salmon: delicious, wine selection: fantastic. 8/10 Iâ€™ll return until Iâ€™ve tried your entire menu
Tiramisu is the best Iâ€™ve ever had!  Definitely get a reservation.  Would love to come back when in town.  Everything tasted great.
We had dinner here after adventuring around The Met. It was about a 10 minute walk from there and a perfect place to stop. The pizza is really good with a lot of variety. ğŸ•

One of the worst dining experiences weâ€™ve had in New York.
We ordered pizza, kids pasta, penne, and filet mignon â€” all were bland, poorly cooked, and far below the quality youâ€™d expect for the price. The service was just as bad: slow, inattentive, and unaccommodating. They even refused to let our 10-year-old order from the kids menu, which she actually wanted. Water came without ice, which summed up the overall lack of care. I donâ€™t know whether the Google reviews are inflated or fake, but the Yelp score is much lower and probably more accurate. Would not recommend to anyone looking for good food or hospitality.

Had an amazing experience at Serafina in New York! The service was top-notch attentive, friendly, and made us feel welcome from the moment we walked in. The pasta was absolutely delicious fresh, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. You can tell they take pride in both their ingredients and presentation. Definitely a spot Iâ€™ll be coming back to, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for authentic Italian food in the city

If you love spicy food, stop here for a pizza.  Habenero peppers are the not so secret ingredient.  We loved it.  Be sure you really like it spicy because this one is hot, the only places that usually mean it are thai restaurants. We didn't have a reservation and were seated on the rooftop terrace which was kinda warm.  They also take inkind which is an app that let's you earn 20% back when you pay your bill.  Great deal!
Good vibes. Great food. My friend and I split the penne arrabiata and pizza with prosciutto. Def recommend.

My wife and I visited during the Christmas holidays and went without a res shortly after they opened on a Saturday. Fortunately, they had room for us,  so definitely make a reservation if you can. My wife had the 4 stagiani pizza (topped with tomato, mozzarella, mushrooms, artichokes, pesto & prosciutto), and I had the RAVIOLI DEGLI INNAMORATI (ravioli with lobster). Both were absolutely delicious! Out of all the restaurants we ate at, this was one of my favorites! Unfortunately, I didn't snap any pics of the food, but it was definitely good!
Bruschetta and the margarita pizza were fantastic. So fresh! Atmosphere was relaxed, airy and pleasant! Great find.

We went this evening on Christmas Eve so it wasnâ€™t completely full.  The food arrived quickly and was hot. Our server was attentive and professional. We ordered the margharita pizza, lobster ravioli, lobster tangilioni,and mushroom ravioli. Everything started wonderful! Great service, amazing food, great atmosphere, Will definitely return.
So happy they offered a vegan option and it was delicious! Cocktails were perfect too!

Are around 4 on Saturday no problem getting a table but it was busy and great atmosphere at service. Bruschetta had fresh tomatoes and basil, wonderful! Pizza had crumbled sausage, mushrooms & fresh basil excellent! Service was prompt and friendly.

Only critique was some areas could have been tidier. Would visit again.

We got a couple of pizzas - both lacked seasoning in the base. Flavor profile was average or below. Gnocchi was undercooked and kinda cold and on the contrary the ravioli was served piping hot which burnt my mouth. Seemed like frozen ravioli that was microwaved and added to a sauce.

Food was average, could be better with either guidance from better chefs or some self innovation from the chef and cooks currently there.

Service was below average - The service manager was rude enough to not greet us and only talk to the staff that was seating us, we saw him a couple of times while in and out and the guy had negative body language. Our waiter seemed to be in a hurry to go back near the kitchen then attending us.

Atmosphere was good on the lower floors but we were seated on the top floor which wasnâ€™t as good as the floors below.

Place has potential but lacked motivation and soul !

Pizza was good. Meatballs not so much. Worth the money ğŸ¤·â€â™‚ï¸

Nice spot, 3rd floor was too hot to sit in in the middle of the day
Always a great experience. Staff is so nice and food is delicious. The tiramisu is always  soooo good!

Extremely mediocre. Do not get the lobster ravioli. It does not really taste like lobster, they give very little lobster in each ravioli, and also donâ€™t give very many ravioli. The portion size is smaller compared to other dishes. The truffle pizza was also not very worth the price in my opinion. It has a strong truffle flavor, Iâ€™ll give it that, but. The cheese was solid and not very melted, and there wasnâ€™t much to the pizza except the solid cheese and truffle flavor. Gnocchi was pretty good, nothing special though. I liked the truffle ravioli and other pizza. Atmosphere is really lovely, great lighting and decor, especially on second floor. Service is good too! Overall would not come back because the food is not worth the price.
Serafina Chicken Salad is the perfect light lunch to enjoy! Everything about it was amazing!

Cute and cozy.   Located on the second floor this location is rather small but comfortable.  The  service was fast and friendly with a nice menu to choose from.  We tried their  mozzarella  avocado and tomato salad and pasta in pink vodka sauce accompanied by a love martini.  Food was good.
Great experience, food was delicious and well served. Our waiter was great, and their service was pretty quick
Great service and delicious food! A must visit in NYC!

I was born and raised in Italy. The food from this restaurant sent me back to Italy ğŸ¤©ğŸ¤©. Everything I had was authentic Italian. The meatballs were excellent (especially the marinara sauce omg), pizza was just as good as the one in the pizzeria across my house in Italyâ€¦tiramisÃº was divine.

If that wasnâ€™t enough, service was excellent. They treated us with courtesy and everyone was very efficient.

Do yourself a favor and go eat at this location!!!

ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹

What an amazing place to eat at on a sunny day! It was such a joy to see the colorful and cheerful decoration of the restaurant. I recommend that you reserve in advance mainly because thereâ€™s no waiting area and you will end up having to queue on the narrow staircase leading up to the restaurant (not very comfortable). Luckily, we did have a reservations so we sat down immediately. The staff was very friendly and the service was quick! We were a party of 3 and we shared a margherita pizza (without olives) and we each had our own pasta dish: 2 of us had the black truffle ravioli dish and I had the Paglia E Fieno (fettucini with creamy tomato sauce). The pizza was phenomenal from crust to toppings! The 2 other people with me LOVED their ravioli dish and I also loved my fettucini dish. What I liked about my fettucini dish is that the homemade fettucini itself was really special and the portion was very generous! I ended up not having dinner that day! Highly recommend this place!
I wish I knew the name of our server because he was phenomenal! The spicy penne aka vodka with burrata was delicious . Loved the atmosphere and I thought the pricing was great for the UES.
We had the Ubah Pizza and it was the best pizse we ever had. Caution: Very Spicy
Great place to stop in for lunch. It was nice and quiet, with a great view. I highly recommend the risotto, it was the best Iâ€™ve ever had. The staff were very friendly also!

The atmosphere was amazing, especially when it thundered and rained outside - and the service was top notch! Of the dishes we ate, we agreed that the spaghetti carbonara was the best! Excellent desserts - with the pistachio tart as a standout!

The pizza is good, and it's an institution. It's conveniently located by a number of museums in Central Park. Reservations are recommended if you're coming during busy hours. Unfortunately with a new crop of pizzerias coming up, like Keste,â€¦

Ordered Spaghetti Carbonara and tiramisu.
Spaghetti carbonara was really, at least for me, TOO salty because of the bacon on the top. I had to leave all the bacon on the plate. Also, thinking of the price of the pasta, it only had spaghetti, sauce, bacon, and parsley.
However, the tiramisu was very good.

Service was okay, didnâ€™t pay attention to what I asked for such as printing receipt after payment. I had to ask separately. Also, I sat at the two people table, and the tables were too close to the tables next to you so you could hear all the conversations, other peopleâ€™s purses touching, etc.

Would not come again.

Cute place close to the Metropolitan Art museum.  Good food, especially the beef Carpaccio and the Meatballs. Delicious sauce.  I did not get to try the pizza, but I liked this place enough that I'll be back and try the pizza next time I'm in the upper East side!

The food was great but small portions and the seating is very tight. There was also a chilly draft but also I think this is reasonable prices for the area and its super close to the MET. I wouldn't recommend this place for large groups of people. The lemon pasta and cocktail were amazing.
Amazing food, service, and atmosphere.    Highly recommend.

We  very much enjoyed the margherita pizza and the bruschetta.

Service is friendly and attentive .

The restaurant is quaint.

Great location close to the Met and just a few minutes from the Guggenheim.
